alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 11:06AM CDT until May 13 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 25.7 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 10/05/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 11.5 Wed 9 am CDT 23.2 25.6 18.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT.
